001package org.biopax.validator.web.controller;
002
003
004import java.io.*;
005import java.net.MalformedURLException;
006import java.util.*;
007
008import javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest;
009import javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse;
010
011import org.apache.commons.logging.Log;
012import org.apache.commons.logging.LogFactory;
013import org.biopax.paxtools.normalizer.Normalizer;
014import org.biopax.validator.api.beans.Behavior;
015import org.biopax.validator.api.beans.Validation;
016import org.biopax.validator.web.service.ValidatorAdapter;
017import org.biopax.validator.api.ValidatorUtils;
018import org.biopax.validator.api.beans.ValidatorResponse;
019import org.springframework.beans.factory.annotation.Autowired;
020import org.springframework.core.io.ByteArrayResource;
021import org.springframework.core.io.Resource;
022import org.springframework.core.io.UrlResource;
023import org.springframework.stereotype.Controller;
024import org.springframework.ui.Model;
025import org.springframework.util.Assert;
026import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.*;
027import org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile;
028import org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartHttpServletRequest;
029
030import static org.springframework.http.MediaType.APPLICATION_XML_VALUE;
031
032@Controller
033public class ValidatorController {
034
035  private ValidatorAdapter service;
036
037  private final static Log log = LogFactory.getLog(ValidatorController.class);
038  private final static String NEWLINE = System.getProperty ( "line.separator" );
039
040  @Autowired
041  public ValidatorController(ValidatorAdapter service) {
042    this.service = service;
043  }
044
045  @RequestMapping(value = {"schema","schema.html"}, method = RequestMethod.GET, produces = APPLICATION_XML_VALUE)
046  @ResponseBody  public String getSchema() {
047    return service.getSchema();
048  }
049
050  //Views (pages)
051
052  @RequestMapping({"/", "home", "home.html"})
053  public String home() {
054    return "home";
055  }
056
057  @RequestMapping({"ws","ws.html"})
058  public String ws() {
059    return "ws";
060  }
061
062  @RequestMapping(value={"check","check.html"}, method=RequestMethod.GET)
063  public void check(Model model) {
064    model.addAttribute("normalizer", new Normalizer());
065    //user can edit some of normalizer's options in the 'check' view
066  }
067
068  /**
069   * JSP pages and RESTful web services controller, the main one that checks BioPAX data.
070   * All parameter names are important, i.e., these are part of public API (for clients)
071   *
072   * System parameters:
073   * @param request the web request object (may contain multi-part data, i.e., multiple files uploaded)
074   * @param response
075   * @param mvcModel Spring MVC Model
076   * @param writer HTTP response writer
077   *
078   * Validator parameters:
079   * @param url
080   * @param retDesired
081   * @param autofix
082   * @param filter
083   * @param maxErrors
084   * @param profile
085   *
086   * Normalizer parameters:
087   * @param normalizer binds to view options: normalizer.fixDisplayName,
088   *                   normalizer.inferPropertyOrganism, normalizer.inferPropertyDataSource
089   * @return results view name (or null if XML or normalized RDF/XML were requested)
090   * @throws IOException when data cannot be read from the files or URL, etc.
091   */
092  @RequestMapping(value={"check","check.html"}, method=RequestMethod.POST)
093  public String check(HttpServletRequest request, HttpServletResponse response,
094                      Model mvcModel, Writer writer,
095    @RequestParam(required=false) String url,
096    @RequestParam(required=false) String retDesired,
097    @RequestParam(required=false) Boolean autofix,
098    @RequestParam(required=false) Behavior filter,
099    @RequestParam(required=false) Integer maxErrors,
100    @RequestParam(required=false) String profile,
101    //normalizer!=null when called from the JSP;
102    //but it's usually null when from the validator-client or a web script
103    @ModelAttribute("normalizer") Normalizer normalizer) throws IOException
104  {
105    Resource resource; //to validate
106    final int lim = (maxErrors != null)? maxErrors.intValue() : 0; //0->no error limit
107    final boolean fix = Boolean.TRUE.equals(autofix);
108
109    // create the response container
110    ValidatorResponse validatorResponse = new ValidatorResponse();
111
112    if(url != null && url.length()>0) {
113      log.info("url : " + url);
114
115      try {
116        resource = new UrlResource(url);
117      } catch (MalformedURLException e) {
118        return errorView(mvcModel, e.toString());
119      }
120
121      try {
122        Validation v = service.validate(resource, lim, fix, filter, profile, normalizer);
123        validatorResponse.addValidationResult(v);
124      } catch (Exception e) {
125        return errorView(mvcModel, e.toString());
126      }
127
128    } else if (request instanceof MultipartHttpServletRequest) {
129      MultipartHttpServletRequest multiRequest = (MultipartHttpServletRequest) request;
130      Map files = multiRequest.getFileMap();
131      Assert.state(!files.isEmpty(), "No files to validate");
132      for (Object o : files.values()) {
133        MultipartFile file = (MultipartFile) o;
134        String filename = file.getOriginalFilename();
135        // a workaround (for some reason there is always a no-name-file;
136        // this might be a javascript isue)
137        if(file.getBytes().length==0 || filename==null || "".equals(filename))
138          continue;
139
140        log.info("check : " + filename);
141        resource = new ByteArrayResource(file.getBytes(), filename);
142        try {
143          Validation v = service.validate(resource, lim, fix, filter, profile, normalizer);
144          validatorResponse.addValidationResult(v);
145        } catch (Exception e) {
146          return errorView(mvcModel, e.toString());
147        }
148      }
149    } else {
150      return errorView(mvcModel, "No BioPAX input source provided!");
151    }
152
153    if("xml".equalsIgnoreCase(retDesired)) {
154      response.setContentType("application/xml");
155      ValidatorUtils.write(validatorResponse, writer, null);
156    } else if("html".equalsIgnoreCase(retDesired)) {
157                /* could also use ValidatorUtils.write with a xml-to-html xslt source
158                 but using JSP here makes it easier to keep the same style, header, footer*/
159      mvcModel.addAttribute("response", validatorResponse);
160      return "groupByCodeResponse";
161    } else { //the fixed/normalized OWL (BioPAX RDF/XML) was requested
162      response.setContentType("text/plain");
163      // write all the models one after another (RDF spec. allows that,
164      // despite Paxtools might not be able to parse it)
165      for(Validation result : validatorResponse.getValidationResult()) {
166        if(result.getModelData() != null)
167          writer.write(result.getModelData() + NEWLINE);
168        else // write "empty" rdf
169          writer.write("<rdf:RDF></rdf:RDF>" + NEWLINE);
170      }
171    }
172    //no view as result/error was written to the response stream
173    return null;
174  }
175
176  private String errorView(Model model, String msg) {
177    model.addAttribute("error", msg);
178    return null;
179  }
180
181}
